title: Not working as documented: go clean -i -x
body:
by **francois.genolini**: 
1. set GOROOT=C:\Go and set GOPATH=C:\your_go_folder
2. create source code in %GOPATH%\src\your\folder\your_project\your_source.go
3. go install your/folder/your_project
4. this creates %GOPATH%\bin\your_project.exe
5. go clean -i

What is the expected output?
all compiled objects and executables should be deleted, including
%GOPATH%\bin\your_project.exe

What do you see instead?
%GOPATH%\bin\your_project.exe still exists (not deleted)

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
8g (according to go build -n)

Which operating system are you using?
Windows 8 Pro N (version 6.2.9200)


Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
Version: go1.0.3


Please provide any additional information below.
Cygwin bash shell
